# Request for Proposal for Traffic Control Services
### Solicitation Number: MA065-A

#### Description:
The National Capital Commission (NCC) is seeking a contractor to provide traffic control services in the province of Quebec for its summer and fall programs.

#### Background:
Gatineau Park's popular sites experience an overflow of visitors by motorized vehicle during the summer and fall seasons. To manage this congestion, active traffic management operations are required to ensure visitor safety and minimize disruptions.

#### Term:
The Contract and Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) will be for a period of three (3) years, commencing on the date of award and ending on March 31st, 2026. The contractor grants to the NCC the irrevocable option to extend the term of the Contract and the SOA by up to two (2) additional one (1) year periods under the same terms and conditions.

#### Bid Deadline:
The bid deadline is no later than 3 p.m. DST on March 30, 2023. Interested proponents must submit their bids by email to Bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca with a reference to tender file #MA065-A.

#### Trade Agreements:
This procurement process is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Basis of Selection:
The responsive offer with the lowest total evaluated price will be recommended for issuance of a contract and a Standing Offer Agreement.

#### Contact Information:
For any inquiries or clarifications, please contact Micheline Al-Koutsi, Senior Contract Officer at micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca.

### Important Information

* All addenda will be posted on canadabuys.canada.ca.
* Interested proponents must not contact any other employee of the NCC or other persons involved in this solicitation to discuss questions regarding the Contract/RFSO process.
* Faxed and hard copy bids will not be accepted for this solicitation.
* The official Government Electronic Tendering Service website is canadabuys.canada.ca. Please ensure that you download your document from this site to obtain all information related to the tender. It is your responsibility to ensure that you have received all the posted tender information to ensure tender compliance and not be disqualified. 
* The bid email has a maximum capacity of 30 megabytes. 

Note: I removed some of the website links, and took the liberty to do some minor ETA corrections for readability (uni code). It's always a pleasure to help with the localization efforts!
